intro: Rhyncholacis brevistamina, commonly known as the short-stamen rhyncholacis, is a rare and lesser-known flowering plant. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with distinctive stamens. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
